   "github_updated_at": "2026-02-07T16:46:59Z",
   "body_snippet": "Good evening\r\n\r\nIf one has a session with multiple Panels (each contains Sessions) and then the last session in a Panel gets closed, then the Panel does not get closed.\r\n\r\nThis is confusing because it is unclear if active sessions are still open in a panel.\r\n\r\n## Expected Behavior\r\nIf the last Session in a Panel gets closed, \r\nthen the Panel should get closed, too.\r\n\r\n## Current Behavior\r\nIf the last Session in a Panel gets closed, \r\nthen the empoy Panel is kept open.\r\n\r\n## Possible Solution\r\nIn...",

+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-21",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "When the last connection tab in a panel is closed, the empty panel should auto-close to avoid orphaned empty docked panels cluttering the layout.",

-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (claude): When the last connection tab in a panel is closed, the empty panel should auto-close to avoid orphaned empty docked panels cluttering the layout.\nApproach: Hook the tab/page removed event on the connection panel; when PageCount reaches 0, call Close() or hide the panel via the docking framework.",
